text:
Heisenbugs that disappear when you add print statements.
EDIT:
Seems that it's there in fresh Julia sessions, but forcing the function to recompile makes it go away.
Although it's often not there in fresh Julia sessions that print.

text: Maybe you are initializing something at top level and that doesn’t get into the precompiled binary? A very wild guess.

text: Although, I don't have that much rr experience. THe erorr is a `MethodError`, not a segfault

elements.text: Although, I don't have that much rr experience. THe erorr is a
MethodError
, not a segfault

text: and all the rr examples I saw were for memory errors like that. I guess you'd really have to know gdb and Julia's compiler internals (I just know some ghosts on first name basis, I don't actually know anything about the compiler) to figure out what's going on?
